Description: Thin crescentic axe-head: Unusually, the central tang expands towards the rear and two short angular lugs project from the lateral tangs. There are no flanges and the cutting end has been filed to an edge in modern times. The blade has been cleaned of corrosion product, revealing surface irregularities, which are the result of the casting process.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (87)
